intro: Michelia compressa, commonly known as the narrow-leaf michelia, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to China. It is characterized by its lance-shaped, aromatic leaves and showy, fragrant white flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant belongs to the family Magnoliaceae and is valued for its ornamental qualities in horticulture. It prefers moist, well-drained soils and partial to full shade, making it suitable for woodland gardens. Michelia compressa is also noted for its ability to thrive in a variety of climates, contributing to its popularity among gardeners.
